turns.content:
can you tell me which of these functions are common to ERC-721 and which are custom?

the contract would have this functions

e4b8c38d => buyAlbum(bytes32[])
8d0eb9f7 => buySong(bytes32[])
26092b83 => publicMint()
e64e51dc => destroyPublic(uint256,uint256)
692b15a3 => claimAlbum(uint256,uint256)
c87b56dd => tokenURI(uint256)
4f1c3244 => setImportantURIs(string,string)
e0052d7c => reclaimERC20Token(address)
6b7d2470 => reclaimERC721(address,uint256)
9ee64d6b => setStartTimes(uint256,uint256,uint256,uint256)
75edcbe0 => setMerkleRoot(bytes32,bytes32)
fce57fd9 => setArtistWallet(address)
a7ccabdf => setNFTContract(address)
8f2fc60b => setRoyalty(address,uint96)
c1ba4e59 => setQuorum(uint256)
ac1251e0 => setPricePerToken(uint256,uint256)
613e9ee4 => setSplitsWallet(address)
3bb16654 => withdrawToSplits()
7d48441f => \_isContract(address)
98995f77 => \_startTokenId()
01ffc9a7 => supportsInterface(bytes4)
280527e8 => isProofValid(address,uint256,bytes32[])
8e4a8ebf => isProofValid2(address,uint256,bytes32[])

' -- vars --
 +[[string]] baseURI
 +[[string]] imageURL
 +[[string]] contractURI
 +[[bytes32]] root
 +[[bytes32]] root2
 +[[uint256]] ablumSaleStartTime
 +[[uint256]] songSaleStartTime
 +[[uint256]] publicStartTime
 +[[uint256]] destroyExperienceStartTime
 +[[uint256]] albumPrice
 +[[uint256]] songPrice
 +[[mapping uint256=>bool ]] belongsToAlbum
 +{static}[[uint256]] MAX\_SUPPLY
 +[[uint256]] quorum
 +[[uint256]] songCounter
 +[[mapping uint256=>TokenTypes ]] tokenTypesMap
 +[[mapping uint256=>uint256 ]] destoryExperinceVotes
 +[[mapping uint256=>bool ]] isRestricted
 +[[address]] splitsWallet
 +[[IERC721]] nftContract
 +[[address]] artistWallet

ERC-721 is a standard for non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on the Ethereum blockchain. It defines a set of required and optional functions that a contract implementing the ERC-721 standard should have.

The functions `buyAlbum`, `buySong`, `publicMint`, `destroyPublic`, `claimAlbum`, `tokenURI`, `setImportantURIs`, `reclaimERC20Token`, `reclaimERC721`, `setStartTimes`, `setMerkleRoot`, `setArtistWallet`, `setNFTContract`, `setRoyalty`, `setQuorum`, `setPricePerToken`, `setSplitsWallet`, `withdrawToSplits`, `_isContract`, `_startTokenId`, `supportsInterface`, `isProofValid`, `isProofValid2` are not part of the ERC-721 standard. They are likely custom functions added to the contract for specific purposes.

The ERC-721 standard defines the following required functions:

* `name`: returns the name of the token.
* `symbol`: returns the symbol of the token.
* `totalSupply`: returns the total supply of tokens.
* `balanceOf`: returns the balance of tokens owned by a given address.
* `ownerOf`: returns the owner of a given token.
* `approve`: allows a given address to transfer a specific token.
* `getApproved`: returns the address that is approved to transfer a specific token.
* `setApprovalForAll`: allows an owner to set or cancel an operator's approval to transfer all of the owner's tokens.
* `isApprovedForAll`: returns whether an operator is approved to transfer all tokens of an owner.
* `transferFrom`: transfers a specific token from one address to another.

The ERC-721 standard also defines the following optional functions:

* `mint`: mints a new token and assigns it to an owner.
* `burn`: destroys a specific token and removes it from circulation.
* `metadata`: returns metadata about a specific token.
* `enumerable`: returns whether a contract implements the optional `Enumerable` interface.

It is possible that the contract you are looking at has implemented some of these functions in addition to the custom functions mentioned above.
can you put all of these functions in a table with a column to indicate whether it is standard or custom?

Sure! Here is a table with all of the functions you listed, with a column indicating whether each function is a part of the ERC-721 standard or a custom function added to the contract:

| Function | Standard |
| --- | --- |
| buyAlbum | Custom |
| buySong | Custom |
| publicMint | Custom |
| destroyPublic | Custom |
| claimAlbum | Custom |
| tokenURI | Custom |
| setImportantURIs | Custom |

| reclaimERC721 | Custom |

| setArtistWallet | Custom |
| setNFTContract | Custom |
| setRoyalty | Custom |
| setQuorum | Custom |
| setPricePerToken | Custom |

| withdrawToSplits | Custom |
| \_isContract | Custom |
| \_startTokenId | Custom |
| supportsInterface | Custom |
| isProofValid | Custom |
| isProofValid2 | Custom |
| name | Standard |
| symbol | Standard |
| totalSupply | Standard |
| balanceOf | Standard |
| ownerOf | Standard |
| approve | Standard |
| getApproved | Standard |
| setApprovalForAll | Standard |
| isApprovedForAll | Standard |

| mint | Optional |
| burn | Optional |

| enumerable | Optional |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
why is tokenURI custom? isn't that part of a standard?

`tokenURI` is not a part of the ERC-721 standard. The ERC-721 standard does not define a function for retrieving a URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) for a specific token.

The ERC-721 standard does, however, include an optional `metadata` function that can be used to return metadata about a specific token. This metadata can include a URI for the token, but the ERC-721 standard does not specify the format or content of the URI. It is up to the contract implementer to decide how to use the `metadata` function and what information to include in the metadata.

In the contract you listed, it looks like the `tokenURI` function has been added as a custom function to retrieve a URI for a specific token. The implementation of this function will depend on how the contract has been implemented and how the URI for each token has been stored.
ok in that table, can you give a brief description of what the function does? to the extent that you know. you can add that brief description in a separate column

Sure! Here is the same table as before, but with a column added for a brief description of each function:

| Function | Standard | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| buyAlbum | Custom | Function for buying an album |
| buySong | Custom | Function for buying a song |
| publicMint | Custom | Function for minting new tokens |
| destroyPublic | Custom | Function for destroying a specific token |
| claimAlbum | Custom | Function for claiming an album |
| tokenURI | Custom | Function for retrieving a URI for a specific token |

| reclaimERC20Token | Custom | Function for reclaiming an ERC-20 token |
| reclaimERC721 | Custom | Function for reclaiming an ERC-721 token |
| setStartTimes | Custom | Function for setting start times |
| setMerkleRoot | Custom | Function for setting the Merkle root |

| setRoyalty | Custom | Function for setting royalties for a specific address |
| setQuorum | Custom | Function for setting the quorum |
| setPricePerToken | Custom | Function for setting the price per token |
| setSplitsWallet | Custom | Function for setting the splits wallet address |
| withdrawToSplits | Custom | Function for withdrawing funds to the splits wallet |
| \_isContract | Custom | Function for checking if an address is a contract |
| \_startTokenId | Custom | Function for retrieving the start token ID |
| supportsInterface | Custom | Function for checking if a contract supports a specific interface |
| isProofValid | Custom | Function for checking if a proof is valid |
| isProofValid2 | Custom | Function for checking if a proof is valid |
| name | Standard | Function for retrieving the name of the token |
| symbol | Standard | Function for retrieving the symbol of the token |
| totalSupply | Standard | Function for retrieving the total supply of tokens |
| balanceOf | Standard | Function for retrieving the balance of tokens owned by a given address |
| ownerOf | Standard | Function for retrieving the owner of a specific token |
| approve | Standard | Function for approving a given address to transfer a specific token |
| getApproved | Standard | Function for retrieving the address that is approved to transfer a specific token |
| setApprovalForAll | Standard | Function for setting or canceling an operator's approval to transfer all of an owner's tokens |
| isApprovedForAll | Standard | Function for checking if an operator is approved to transfer all tokens of an owner |
| transferFrom | Standard | Function for transferring a specific token from one address to another |
| mint | Optional | Function for minting a new token and assigning it to an owner |
| burn | Optional | Function for destroying a specific token and removing it from circulation |
| metadata | Optional | Function for retrieving metadata about a specific token |
| enumerable | Optional | Function for checking if a contract implements the optional `Enumerable` interface |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.
